result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa P Calvert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa P Calvert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa P Calvert was found guilty of Attempt Attempt Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable Court costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid over the duration of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
No Contact Order remains with codefendant.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant only to take prescribed medication as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa P Calvert

At the time this case was last in court, new counsel had not yet been appointed for the co-defendant. Court will allow the substitution of judge on todays date.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/28/2014 at 8:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted.  Justice Point monitoring to be reinstated.  Status conference scheduled for 08-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Melissa P Calvert not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

State advised that COUNT 3 is DISMISSED and nthe amended charge filed yesterday is to COUNT 4.

The co-defendant case did not proceed to trial at this time.  

Court ordered cash bail reduced back to $10000.00 (previously mposted)  with TOT Justice Point Monitoring:  
Drug testing - Breathe testing - Absolute sobriety - No controled substances - NO WEAPONS - No contact with Antone H. or Myeshia C.

Parties are informed that effective 08-02-14 this case will be reassigned to Branch 47  Judge Siefert due to rotation.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47
Status conference scheduled for 07-08-2014 at 01:30 pm.

TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

Request for a PSI with no recommendation granted.

Case is adjourned to 07-08-14 for status on testimony.

Cash bail is increased to $11,000.00 with all previous conditions remaining.

Defendant Melissa P Calvert in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Melissa P Calvert in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timonty Keller-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Antonio H., Myiesha C., Henry Brookshire (co-defendant) and the address of 2459 S. 43rd St., Milwaukee, WI.
